DOC.brief_summary: The Children Action ( CIA ) program five month physical activity intervention . This intervention feasibility study 3- 5-year-olds enrol four Head Start center . After baseline assessment , center match ethnicity number participant randomly assign either intervention control condition . A total 224 preschool child randomly select across four center . To evaluate efficacy CIA intervention , change physical activity , gross motor skill weight awake time use mixed effect time-series regression model compare . Observations show statistical difference intervention control group physical activity level awake time , gross motor development weight status . It demonstrate feasible conduct SPARK-EC curriculum among preschool child attend Head Start Centers increase dose and/or long intervention duration require impact gross motor skill , weight status physical activity level critical early childhood development stage .
DOC.criteria: 35 year old attends Head Start AfricanAmerican HispanicAmerican old 5 year old attend Head Start race/ethnicity AfricanAmerican HispanicAmerican disability handicap would prevent participate physical activity
